title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 17 June 2013 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius\_> has quit  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
05:51 <Denis> has quit  
07:25 <sdumitriu> has quit  
07:26 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
08:07 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:16 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:19 <abusenius\_> has joined #xwiki  
08:37 <abusenius\_> has quit  
08:47 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:01 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:02 <altker128> has joined #xwiki  
09:25 <altker128> Gu, why does xwiki show connections to 5.135.240.206 & 91.121.34.179 ?  
09:25 <altker128> err, guys  
09:26 <vmassol> extension repository?  
09:27 <altker128> vmassol: Does the extentions repository auto-browse on start-up?  
09:27 <vmassol> yes  
09:27 <altker128> Can that be disabled?  
09:27 <vmassol> to check if there are UI upgrades for your extension  
09:27 <vmassol> I don't think you can remove just the auto check  
09:27 <vmassol> but  
09:27 <vmassol> you can disable the EM  
09:28 <vmassol> edit your xwiki.properties file and set an empty list of extension repositories  
09:28 <vmassol> you'll loose the ability to install extensions through the EM though which is a pity  
09:28 <altker128> vmassol: Well, I normally keep my private servers disconnected from the internet  
09:28 <altker128> seems xwiki is intent on trying to connect...  
09:29 <vmassol> your choice  
09:29 <vmassol> you can temporarily disable and reenable when needed  
09:29 <altker128> yes  
09:29 <altker128> How do you suggest killing the repo?  
09:29 <altker128> removing everything after the "=" ?  
09:30 <altker128> (what is the "right" way to do this?)  
09:30 <vmassol> yes  
09:30 <vmassol> extension.repositories=  
09:30 <vmassol> that should do it  
09:33 <altker128> hrm  
09:33 <altker128> that did not work  
09:34 <altker128> netstat still shows connections  
09:35 <vmassol> check the ip for extensions.xwiki.org to verify it's the same one  
09:36 <tmortagne> altker128: you sure you uncommented the line ?  
09:36 <altker128> tmortagne: Oh...  
09:37 <vmassol> don't uncomment btw  
09:37 <vmassol> just add a new line  
09:37 <tmortagne> (what's in the conf file is just an example)  
09:37 <vmassol> with:  
09:37 <vmassol> extension.repositories=  
09:37 <altker128> yes, that worked  
09:38 <altker128> sorry for the dumb question  
09:39 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:39 <altker128> Thanks.  
09:39 <altker128> no weird network activity :)  
09:40 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:42 <mflorea> vmassol: do you have a minute?  
09:42 <vmassol> yes in 3 minutes :)  
09:44 <mflorea> I'm trying to add the xwiki-platform-wysiwyg-test module, and I'm having an issue with the packager plugin. It packages the wysiwyg jars but not the war, i.e. not the js/css resources. The question is where should I fix this, in the packager or in my pom? I fixed it in the pacakger so far, but maybe the reason the editor war wasn't pacakged is because you though it wasn't needed in general  
09:45 <msmeria> has quit  
09:46 <mflorea> fixing the problem in my pom has 2 issues: (1) I need to add dependency on platform-web and root-webapp, and more importantly, (2) the packager unpacks a war in a folder with the same name, expect for platform-web and root-webapp which are handled separtely.  
09:47 <mflorea> So if I add a dep to wysiwyg war in my pom I get xwiki-platform-wysiwyg-war folder on the same level with "webaps/xwiki" and "webapps/root"  
09:47 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:47 <mflorea> that's why I decided to fix the problem in the packager plugin  
09:48 <mflorea> i.e. add dep to wysiwyg war (instead of the jars, because the war brings the jars) and unpack it in "xwiki" folder  
09:51 <mflorea> so basically the question is: should the "xwiki" generated by the packager plugin have a working WYSIWYG editor? If not, then it would be great if the packager plugin offered a simple way to merge a war dep in "xwiki" folder (i.e. merge with platform web war)  
09:53 <vmassol> back, reading mflorea  
09:56 <vmassol> mflorea: IMO our general direction should be to remove more and more from the packager plugin so that all deps are added by projects. This will happen as we resolve our missing dependencies between existing modules. Packaging the wysiwyg editor for ex should be optional indeed and come as a dependecy ideally  
09:56 <vmassol> I don't know what's practical rigth now on this topic though  
09:56 <vmassol> ATM we have quite a lot of stuff hardcoded in the packager plugin which isn't that nice  
09:56 <vmassol> and we keep adding them. At some point we need to clean that up and remove what we can remove  
09:57 <vmassol> so  
09:57 <mflorea> I agree, but it's complicated to merge a war in the "xwiki" folder with what the packaer plugin offers right now..  
09:57 <vmassol> in your case maybe the only possible solution ATM is to have it in the packager plugin (I don't know really about that) but we need to keep in mind that this means we'll need to remove it in the future and work on our deps  
09:58 <vmassol> sure, maybe the packager plugin also needs to offer some additional generic features  
10:01 <mflorea> vmassol: ok, thanks  
10:06 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:12 <jrgill> has quit  
10:13 <jrgill> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <altker128> For normal users is there a way to hide spaces like Macros ?  
10:14 <altker128> Administration for Macros shows no one has permissions to view  
10:23 <jrgill> has quit  
10:24 <jrgill> has joined #xwiki  
10:25 <jrgill> has quit  
10:26 <jrgill> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <jrgill> has quit  
10:34 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
10:35 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:37 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:41 <altker128> vmassol: Are the instructions for the Workspace application listed here (http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Workspace+Application) still right?  
10:42 <altker128> it seems like xwiki runs in virtual mode all the time now  
10:43 <vmassol> altker128: yes since 5.0, we need to update all docs  
10:44 <altker128> WorkspaceManager is complaining that the template wasn't there, so I downloaded the 5.02 template, rename and velocity is giving errors  
10:44 <altker128> http://pastebin.com/2FpULMja  
10:46 <vmassol> altker128: please report any issue you have in jira. I don't know much about workspaces myself but I'm sure others know about it. Your other option is to ask on the mailing list if nobody answers here  
10:47 <altker128> OK.  Sorry to have worn your patience thin  
10:48 <altker128> vmassol: Can normal users create wikis without workspace manager?  
10:58 <vmassol> altker128: yes, all they need is wiki-manager UI  
10:59 <altker128> hrm.  But that's different than the workspace one  
10:59 <vmassol> and?  
10:59 <altker128> Sorry, that was a question  
10:59 <vmassol> workspace manager uses wiki-manager  
11:00 <vmassol> check the workspace doc on e.x.o  
11:00 <vmassol> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Workspace+Application  
11:00 <vmassol> you'll see in the dependnecies section what it depends on  
11:00 <vmassol> I have no idea what you want to do  
11:01 <vmassol> just answerinr your question  
11:01 <altker128> Nothing crazy, something basic  
11:01 <vmassol> then just use workspace  
11:01 <vmassol> why do you ask?  
11:01 <altker128> Well, I'm struggling to get workspace manager installed  
11:01 <altker128> but wiki manager installed  
11:02 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
11:03 <altker128> vmassol: Basically I just want users to be able to add Spaces and Pages which I think can be done without any additional stuffs  
11:04 <altker128> The default 'Spaces' include Blog, Macros, Main, Sandbox .  Can they be deleted?  I'd like the default spaces to be blank  
11:04 <vmassol> altker128: you don't need workspaces fro that since that's inter wiki  
11:04 <altker128> Yes  
11:04 <altker128> I'm wrapping my head around the terminology  
11:04 <vmassol> ok  
11:04 <altker128> I understand 'farm' vs. 'wiki' now, etc  
11:04 <vmassol> you can remove pages or extensions yes  
11:05 <vmassol> for ex the blog app can be removed  
11:05 <altker128> Will I break anything by removing 'Macros' ?  
11:05 <vmassol> by default there's no Macros space  
11:05 <vmassol> so this was created  
11:05 <vmassol> by some extensions you added  
11:05 <vmassol> or some pages you imported  
11:05 <altker128> hrm  
11:05 <vmassol> so if you remove it you'll just break those features you imported ;)  
11:05 <vmassol> but that's ok  
11:05 <vmassol> depend on what you wish to do  
11:06 <altker128> vmassol: Can I just hide it from being displayed?  
11:06 <vmassol> yes  
11:06 <vmassol> actually  
11:06 <vmassol> they should have been hidden  
11:06 <altker128> But they are not  
11:06 <vmassol> it's just that the extension author has forgotten to marke them hiden  
11:06 <vmassol> \*mark  
11:06 <vmassol> so you go to a page  
11:06 <vmassol> you edit it in and check the "hidden" checkbox  
11:06 <jrgill> has joined #xwiki  
11:06 <vmassol> s/in//  
11:09 <altker128> vmassol: So to hide a given 'Space' , what gets clicked?  
11:09 <altker128> vmassol: wrench or book?  
11:09 <SvenDowideit\_> has quit  
11:10 <vmassol> to hide a space you need to hide all docs in that space  
11:10 <Denis> has quit  
11:11 <altker128> if I click on 'Macros' for example it says "Requested document could not be found."  
11:11 <vmassol> yes that means you're going to Macros.WebHome  
11:11 <vmassol> which doesn't exist apprently  
11:11 <vmassol> but it doesn't mean that no other pages exist in that space  
11:11 <vmassol> it just means there's no WebHome page  
11:11 <vmassol> just list all pages for the sapce  
11:11 <vmassol> space  
11:12 <vmassol> Wiki menu at top, Document Index, filter space "Macro"  
11:12 <vmassol> (for ex)  
11:12 <altker128> ah  
11:12 <altker128> yes  
11:12 <altker128> makes sense  
11:12 <vmassol> or in the spaces list  
11:12 <altker128> Page is 'Highlight'  
11:12 <vmassol> hover over the sapce  
11:12 <vmassol> and click the icon to list all docs in that space  
11:12 <vmassol> "see space index)  
11:12 <vmassol> "  
11:12 <altker128> Yes, must have been enabled for the syntax highlighting plug-in  
11:13 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
11:13 <vmassol> if you"ve installed some extension through the EM  
11:13 <altker128> So I see pages in Macros space  
11:13 <altker128> vmassol: Yes  
11:13 <vmassol> then you can remove it and it'll remove the pages  
11:13 <altker128> I guess I want to keep the syntax highlighting, but how can I hide this page so that space is not shown?  
11:14 <vmassol> read what I said above :)  
11:14 <vmassol> so you go to a page  
11:14 <vmassol> 11:06  
11:14 <vmassol> you edit it in and check the "hidden" checkbox  
11:14 <vmassol> (and save)  
11:14 <altker128> Yeah, on the far right top  
11:15 <altker128> 'hidden document'  
11:15 <altker128> ok let me try  
11:15 <altker128> Awesome it worked  
11:16 <altker128> vmassol:  Where are you located?  
11:16 <vmassol> north of France  
11:16 <altker128> Is there any computer equipment you need?  
11:17 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
11:17 <altker128> Maybe I can send something to thank you for your help :)  
11:17 <vmassol> wdym? :)  
11:17 <vmassol> wow first time someone suggest this ;)  
11:17 <altker128> Sandybridge Intel motherboard?  
11:17 <altker128> DP67De  
11:17 <altker128> DP67DE  
11:17 <altker128> (new)  
11:18 <vmassol> nice  
11:18 <polx> has quit  
11:18 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
11:21 <vmassol> altker128: fyi http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/How+can+I+hide+a+space+for+some+users  
11:21 <altker128> I saw, your cool bot just informed me of the change :)  
11:21 <polx> has quit  
11:21 <vmassol> :)  
11:22 <altker128> Can I modify that page?  
11:22 <vmassol> msmeria, sburjan: could be cool if you could add doc about this hidden option on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/PageEditing  
11:22 <vmassol> (when you get the time)  
11:22 <vmassol> altker128: yes sure!  
11:23 <vmassol> you're even encouraged to do so  
11:23 <vmassol> it's a wiki maintained by the community  
11:23 <sburjan> vmassol: about the hidden option ? make a page hidden ?  
11:24 <vmassol> sburjan: yes the "hidden" checkbox when editing page  
11:24 <vmassol> I've realized it's not documented  
11:24 <vmassol> some screenshot and explanation would be nice I think  
11:24 <vmassol> if can help that's great  
11:24 <vmassol> \*you  
11:24 <vmassol> sburjan: I wanted to link it from http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/How+can+I+hide+a+space+for+some+users but since it's not documented I couldn't  
11:25 <altker128> vmassol: I'll take some screen shots tomorrow and modify the wiki  
11:25 <altker128> After your explanation it makes sense why the space shows  
11:25 <sburjan> I'll let altker128  do it to encourage him to participate  
11:25 <altker128> sburjan: :)  
11:25 <vmassol> ok altker128 we'll let you do that, cool ;)  
11:25 <altker128> Ok, will do it tomorrow.  Very late and must sleep  
11:26 <altker128> vmassol: One thought, if one clicks on a space and there is no 'web view' then it defaults to the index listing  
11:26 <vmassol> web view =?  
11:26 <vmassol> you mean no webhome page  
11:26 <vmassol> ?  
11:26 <vmassol> WebHome  
11:27 <altker128> vmassol: Sorry, WebHome  
11:27 <altker128> yes  
11:27 <vmassol> right now if you click on a space it always try to go to WebHome even if it doesn't exist  
11:27 <vmassol> are you suggesting an improvmeent+?  
11:27 <altker128> vmassol: Yes, basically.  That maybe it can say edit this page to create or click document index to see listing  
11:27 <vmassol> what we could do  
11:27 <altker128> I wouldn't have thought to have done that until you told me the space appears because there is some document there.  
11:27 <vmassol> is still go to the page that doesn't exist  
11:27 <vmassol> but where it says that the page doesn't exist  
11:28 <vmassol> also offer a link to the space index  
11:28 <altker128> Yes  
11:28 <altker128> vmassol: Yes, basically.  That maybe it can say edit this page to create or click document index to see listing <--- :0  
11:28 <altker128> I think similar idea  
11:28 <vmassol> yes  
11:28 <vmassol> you could suggest it in an improvement jira  
11:28 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org  
11:28 <vmassol> would be great  
11:28 <altker128> OK.  Now I must use my internal list tracking to keep track of the things I need to do for XWiki :)  
11:28 <vmassol> :)  
11:30 <altker128> I'm using Horde for my task listing  
11:31 <altker128> You guys make use of CalDAV stuff too?  
11:31 <altker128> Or use XWiki for it all? :)  
11:32 <vmassol> yeah we tend to use xwiki quite often....  
11:33 <vmassol> for anything that require collaboration  
11:33 <altker128> Do you have synchronization with your mobile devices?  
11:34 <vmassol> no  
11:34 <vmassol> but you can access xwiki on mobile devices  
11:34 <vmassol> there's a skin and an app for that  
11:35 <altker128> I've also been working on CalDAV stuff for Android  
11:37 <vmassol> FYI I've coded a simple extension here for calendar integration: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/FullCalendar+Application  
11:37 <altker128> Would be cool if it could subscribe to ICS calendars  
11:37 <altker128> ICS files  
11:37 <vmassol> I think it can  
11:37 <vmassol> no caldav though I think  
11:38 <vmassol> see http://arshaw.com/fullcalendar/  
11:38 <vmassol> (bottom)  
11:38 <vmassol> events: 'http://www.google.com/calendar/feeds/usa\_\_en%40holiday.calendar.google.com/public/basic',  
11:38 <vmassol> (for ex)  
11:38 <altker128> Very nice  
11:39 <altker128> There's CalDAVZap which is pretty cool but that's more feature complete  
11:42 <altker128> ok, must sleep  
11:42 <vmassol> ok nn  
11:42 <altker128> Thank you kindly for your help  
11:42 <altker128> merci beaucoups  
11:42 <altker128> beaucoup even  
11:42 <mflorea> vmassol: still on my packager plugin issue, I'm trying to avoid packaging the editor by default but I've hit another issue. The resolveWarArtifacts method https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-tools/xwiki-platform-tool-packager-plugin/src/main/java/org/xwiki/tool/packager/PackageMojo.java#L515 breaks after finding the first war artifact.. So I can't have both platform web and wysiwyg war as deps.  
11:42 <vmassol> np  
11:42 <vmassol> ;)

12:34 <jrgill> has joined #xwiki

12:58 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
13:04 <polx> has quit  
13:58 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:12 <vmassol> guys I have some issue with XWQL  
14:12 <vmassol> I have this query: "where doc.object(XWiki.XWikiServerClass).server = :wikiAlias"  
14:13 <vmassol> I see it's transformed into:  
14:13 <vmassol> select doc.fullName from XWikiDocument as doc , BaseObject as \_o1, com.xpn.xwiki.objects.StringProperty as \_o1\_server2 where ( \_o1\_server2.value = ':wikiAlias' ) and doc.fullName=\_o1.name and \_o1.className='XWiki.XWikiServerClass' and \_o1\_server2.id.id=\_o1.id and \_o1\_server2.id.name='server'  
14:13 <vmassol> note the single quotes around :wikiAlias  
14:13 <vmassol> I get this error:  
14:13 <vmassol> Exception while hibernate execute|Wrapped Exception: could not locate named parameter [wikiAlias]  
14:14 <vmassol> I think that's because of the single quotes  
14:14 <vmassol> any idea?  
14:14 <vmassol> this looks like a bug to me  
14:14 <vmassol> (a conversion bug)  
14:15 <vmassol> ah wait  
14:18 <vmassol> forget it, was a problem on my side  
14:19 <vmassol> has quit  
14:21 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
14:29 <vmassol> tmortagne: can you confirm that our Cache doesn't support null values when calling #set(), i.e. the key/value is not stored when the value is null?  
14:41 <sburjan> tmortagne: ping  
14:43 <tmortagne> vmassol: (was OTP) I don't remember, need to check  
14:44 <vmassol> tmortagne: I set that get returns null if it doesn't exist so it would seem "logical"  
14:44 <tmortagne> back OTP...  
14:47 <tmortagne> vmassol: the idea is that it's working like Map so yes get return null  
14:47 <vmassol> but map allows null  
14:47 <tmortagne> sure but you don't have contains in cache api  
14:48 <tmortagne> so the fact that it's really stored or not would not change much for you  
14:48 <vmassol> ok so contains would return true if it existed?  
14:48 <vmassol> anyway  
14:48 <tmortagne> all I'm saying is that we don't really care soince that does not exist  
14:48 <vmassol> I've found a solution for my need  
14:48 <vmassol> don't use Cache :)  
14:49 <tmortagne> vmassol:  if you need to to make a difference then you don't use Cache  
14:51 <tmortagne> in other words that an implementation details and it does not change anything at API level  
14:58 <vmassol> argh ConcurrentHashMap doesn't support null for key or value...  
14:59 <vmassol> ok I'll do some magic :)  
15:03 <tmortagne> vmassol: you really need to make a difference between null and no entry ?  
15:04 <vmassol> yes but don't worry I have a solution  
15:04 <vmassol>     private static final WikiDescriptor EMPTY\_DESCRIPTOR = new WikiDescriptor(null, null);  
15:04 <vmassol> FYI the reason is because I don't want to look up again a wiki alias or wiki id that has alreayd been looked up even if there was no descriptor for it  
15:33 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
15:56 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
15:58 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
16:06 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
16:11 <vmassol> hmm there's no way to know the value of a document's xproperty before it's saved when listening to events? If I listen to DocumentUpdatingEvent for ex, I'll get the new values only… Hmm actually I guess I can use xwikiContext.getWiki().getDocument() ….  
16:22 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
16:25 <tmortagne> vmassol: you have xproperty events  
16:26 <tmortagne> and if you don't want one specific property then the way is to compare the document and document.getOriginalDocument()  
16:37 <vmassol> ah indeed had forgotten about getOriginalDocument() thanks
